intro: Cordyline floribunda, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and striking, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value. Cordyline floribunda is also valued for its cultural significance to Māori communities.
